org.openadaptor.thirdparty.dom4j
Class Dom4jSimpleRecordAccessor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.thirdparty.dom4j.Dom4jSimpleRecordAccessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, ISimpleRecord, ISimpleRecordAccessor
public class Dom4jSimpleRecordAccessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISimpleRecordAccessor, ISimpleRecord

Utility class to represent Dom4j Document instances as ISimpleRecord instances.

This class is an enabler to facilitate us in applying generic transformations to Document instances.

Author:
Eddy Higgins

Field Detail

valueTypeAttributeName

protected java.lang.String valueTypeAttributeName
this attribute specifies the attribute which contains the java type of the value. If omitted, java.lang.String is assumed.

preserveIncomingXMLFormat

protected boolean preserveIncomingXMLFormat
This influences how getRecord() returns its underlying record. If true, it will return a dom4j Document if one was originally supplied or an XML String if a String was originally supplied. If false, it will always return a Dom4j Document object.

The default value is true, for defencive reasons (princible of least surprise I guess). Note that could be inefficient in cases where further XML-related processing of the data happens downstream, and the incoming data records XML Strings ,as they will be converted into dom4j, processed, and converted back to XML Strings for compatibility.

incomingWasString

protected boolean incomingWasString
Internal flag to remember incoming record format.

Constructor Detail

Dom4jSimpleRecordAccessor

public Dom4jSimpleRecordAccessor()
Default constructor.

In normal circumstances this should only be used by Spring.

Method Detail

getValueTypeAttributeName

public java.lang.String getValueTypeAttributeName()
If set, this attribute specifies the name of an attribute which may then (optionally) contains the java type to use when returning an Element's value. If it is not set, or if if a given attribute does not have that named attribute, then gets will return a java.lang.String representation

Returns:
the name of the type attribute, or null.

setValueTypeAttributeName

public void setValueTypeAttributeName(java.lang.String valueTypeAttributeName)
If set, this attribute specifies an attribute which may contains the java type to use for an Element's value.

If null, or the attribute is not set within an Element, java.lang.String is assumed.

Parameters:
valueTypeAttributeName - is a String containing the attribute which specifies the type

getPreserveIncomingXMLFormat

public boolean getPreserveIncomingXMLFormat()
if true then calls to getRecord() will return a record in the same format as was used by asSimplerecord(), otherwise it will return a Dom4j Document.

The default is true, to avoid confusion whereby an incoming XML String might end up as an outgoing Dom4j Document unexpectedly.

Returns:
Current value for this flag.

setPreserveIncomingXMLFormat

public void setPreserveIncomingXMLFormat(boolean preserveIncomingXMLFormat)
Sets preferred behaviour when converting Records. if set to true then calls to getRecord() will return a record in the same format as was used by asSimplerecord(), otherwise it will return a Dom4j Document.

The default is true, to avoid confusion whereby an incoming XML String might end up as an outgoing Dom4j Document unexpectedly. In practice, it might be better to set it to false, or to ensure that asSimpleRecord() is provided with a Dom4j Document, for efficiency reasons. This is much more likely to avoid implicit (and expensive) conversions to and from XML Strings inadvertently.

Parameters:
preserveIncomingXMLFormat - Boolean flag indicating whether getRecord() should return the same record format as asSimpleRecord() got.

get

public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
                     throws RecordException
Retrieve a named value from the underlying Dom4j Document.

The key should have the form of a simplified XPath path. Note that array subscripts are not currently supported.

The returned value will be the text of the element identified by the supplied path, unless the valueTypeAttributeName property is set, and the selected element has this attribute. Then the type of the returned value is governed by the value of the type attribute - currently one of Double,Long,Date or String. If valueTypeAttributeName attribute is not set it defaults to String.

Specified by:
get in interface ISimpleRecord
Parameters:
key - a simplified XPath path
Returns:
The object associated with the supplied key
Throws:
RecordException - if the operation cannot be completed.

put

public java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
                     throws RecordException
Store the suppplied object in the underlying Dom4j Document at the location defined by the supplied key.

Note - if the path does not exist, it will attempt to create it.

Currently the value stored simply uses the Object's toString() method. //ToDo: allow it to set the type attribute also.

Specified by:
put in interface ISimpleRecord
Parameters:
key - an XPath like expression with the path.
value - Object to be stored.
Returns:
The Object which has just been stored.
Throws:
RecordException - if the operation cannot be completed.

remove

public java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.Object key)
                        throws RecordException
Remove and return an attribute from the document, given it's key.

If the node isn't found, then no action is taken.

Specified by:
remove in interface ISimpleRecord
Parameters:
key - corresponding to the object being searched for.
Returns:
The Object which has been removed, or null if not found.
Throws:
RecordException - if the operation cannot be completed.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Shallow copy this accessor, but also the Dom4j Document it encapsulates.

Specified by:
clone in interface ISimpleRecord
Returns:
Dom4jSimpleRecordAccessor with identical properties, and cloned Document.

getRecord

public java.lang.Object getRecord()
This returns the underlying Object that this class is fronting as an ISimpleRecord. It will return an XML String if asSimpleRecord() was originally provided with one, and preserveIncomingXMLFormat property is true. Otherwise it will return a Dom4j Document

Specified by:
getRecord in interface ISimpleRecord
Returns:
Dom4jDocument or String (as outlined above)

clear

public void clear()
Remove all document except the root Element itself, if any.

Specified by:
clear in interface ISimpleRecord

asSimpleRecord

public ISimpleRecord asSimpleRecord(java.lang.Object record)
                             throws RecordException
Get an ISimpleRecordview on the supplied record Object.

This approximates the inverse of getRecord(), subject to the influence (of preserveIncomingXMLFormat)

Specified by:
asSimpleRecord in interface ISimpleRecordAccessor
Parameters:
record - The object to be represented as an ISimpleRecord. Must be an XMLString or a Dom4J Document
Returns:
ISimpleRecord view on the underlying XML Document.
Throws:
RecordException - if the record cannot be represented as an ISimpleRecord
